title: airBaltic to Launch Tallinn – Stockholm, Bromma airportTravelandtourworld.com
text:
airBaltic to Launch Tallinn – Stockholm, Bromma airport
The Latvian airline airBaltic will launch a new route between Tallinn and Stockholm, Bromma airport on March 27, 2016. The new route will offer convenient travel between the two cities and support business communities in both Estonia and Sweden.
Christophe Viatte, Chief Commercial Officer of airBaltic: “Tallinn – Stockholm Bromma is
convenient link for the business traveller between the capitals of Sweden and Estonia, and it is part of our strategy to operate 11 direct services out of Tallinn in the coming five years.”
airBaltic will fly from Tallinn to Stockholm, Bromma airport twelve times a week.
Passengers will board a Bombardier Q400 NextGen aircraft for a flight that will last 1 hour 10 minutes.
One-way ticket prices will start at EUR 55, including airport fees and transaction costs.
Source:- airBaltic
